definition: the act of looking or seeing or observing, to deem to be
details:
noun
- the act of looking or seeing or observing
= example: the act of looking or seeing or observing
= synonyms: survey
- graphic art consisting of the graphic or photographic representation of a visual percept
= synonyms: scene
- outward appearance
= example: outward appearance
- the range of interest or activity that can be anticipated
= synonyms: horizon, purview
- the visual percept of a region
= example: the visual percept of a region
= synonyms: prospect
- a personal belief or judgment that is not founded on proof or certainty
= synonyms: opinion, thought, sentiment, persuasion
- purpose
= example: purpose
- a way of regarding situations or topics etc.
= example: a way of regarding situations or topics etc.
= synonyms: position
- a message expressing a belief about something
= synonyms: opinion
- the range of the eye
= example: the range of the eye
= synonyms: eyeshot
verb
- to deem to be
= example: to deem to be
= synonyms: regard
- look at carefully
= synonyms: look at, consider
- see or watch
= example: see or watch
= synonyms: catch
